TopicTitle: Drop the long-deprecated directories (parts, plugins ...) from the KSP subtree.

Articles.Content: They are still causing confusion and problems to new players who try to install mods either following outdated instructions or using outdated mods.

I second this.

While I'm at it, how about a pair of ships/subassembly folders that are shared between saves?
Yup...I was surprised when I saw that they were still present in 1.0...

> 
> Yup...I was surprised when I saw that they were still present in 1.0...

The launcher still has an option for 64 bit, as well. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I concur with the OP's sentiments.

Virtually all current add-ons have migrated to using the convenient and intuitive GameData system, and there are no older add-ons compatible with 0.90/1.0 that require the legacy Parts/Plugin folders.

18 months and 3(?) major versions later, and this is still causing problems for inexperienced users and those following instructions from old forum threads and random internet pages...  is there some underlying technical reason for them still being present, or is it simply a case of 'can't be bothered to edit a few files' ?

I tried deleting them manually. The game re-created them on start.
